TutorialDataSteps.janeText: Welcome, welcome to Battleground!
You must be tired from your travels - sit, drink, relax and let's play a few rounds!
I'm Jane - a pleasure!

When you're ready, I can show you the ropes. 

 If you already know how to play, you can just get started
Let's dive right in!!
Notice your Goo Bottles on the left - that's your Fuel
You'll need that to power your zombies in order to move them from your Hand to the Battleground
Each zombie has a Goo Cost, let’s drag your first card into the battleground!
Don't worry, I filled up your goo so you can drop a powerful General!
Notice the zZz - that means your zombie needs to rest until it activates in the next turn
Wonderful! Now that you're done with your turn, you can press the End Turn button, right there on the right
Each player, in their turn, will draw zombies to the battleground

Let’s wait for your turn and 
see what we can do
Excellent! Let's Drag your zombie onto the enemy zombie so we can attack him!
Notice that your Attack Value is deducted from the enemy zombie's Defense Value
Well done!! You dispatched your first zombie, soon you'll be a veteran Zombie Slayer!!
Let’s press End Turn
See, your opponent will try to kill your zombies as well, so you have to plan your moves!
The main goal is to beat the enemy Overlord, the first one to do so wins the match, no matter how many zombies are on the battleground!
Let's try to attack the enemy Overlord now!

Excellent! 
Seems like you're getting the hang of it!
Let’s continue
Ahh, look - they’re using a Heavy zombie to defend their troops!

We'll have to remove it in order 
to attack them again!
Damn - you’re out of active zombies on the battleground...
Wait - you have some goo and a Feral zombie at the ready in your hand!
Feral zombies are a little weaker, but they are super fast - they can attack as soon as they land in the battleground!
Let's use one! Drag your feral zombie from your hand into the battleground
Now, you can attack your opponent's Overlord immediately!
Awesome! Now would be the perfect time to use your Overlord Ability
Overlord abilities don’t require Goo to use, but they take a few turns to get ready at the start of a match and after every use.
Your Overlord can have two abilities available during a match and can use both of them in a turn if necessary.
Time to use one of your Overlord Abilities to attack the enemy Overlord and finish him off!

NOICE!! 
You won your first match!
What did I tell you? A bonafide Zombie Slayer, Oh-Yeah!!

Now you're ready to start 
your grand adventure!
Good luck - Zombie Slayer!!

Welcome back, Zombie Slayer! 
It's me Jane, remember? 
Time for advanced play! 
Are you up for it?

Looks like you’re in the middle of a match... 
...in a bit of a pickle too

Hmm, one more hit and it's game over. 
The enemy has one intimidating zombie in play, 
...not good at all
YES! Exactly what we needed!
Let's drop the big one! General Cherno-bill - and MELT, MELT!

To do that you need 11 Goo. 
Right now, you only have 10
Good thing you got Zeptic, he's a Goo-Carrier
Goo-Carriers give you extra goo to spend for this turn only! This effect is called Overflow
Remember, only Goo-Carriers of the same element as your Overlord will work
Overflow is for this turn only, and comes with some setbacks. So... it's a calculated risk!
Each goo-carrier has it's own drawback depending on it's elemental faction
Toxic zombies specialize in dealing extra damage
So, Toxic goo-carriers, for example, deal damage to your own Overlord
Go ahead, let’s drag Zeptic into play and get Overflow going!

Great! ...zz-plan iz unfolding! muhaha 
See - the Overflow gauge is about to burst - and is now 11!!

We have the goo to drop the big one! 
Let’s show the enemy Overlord how it's done!
OH, DID YOU SEE THAT?!?!?
Check that out - your Poizoms got +1 Attack and the Destroy ability!
This is the Ranks System at work
See - we have ranks in the zombie army, the higher their rank the rarer and more powerful they are!

Minions are naturally the weakest, followed by Officers. 
Then Commanders and finally the fearsome Generals!

Now, when we have a higher 
ranking zombie in play. 
The lower ranks of its 
element get buffed. 
The higher the rank, 
the stronger the buff
Just remember - each of the 6 elements causes a different effect
For instance, Toxic Generals like Cherno-bill give 3 lower ranking toxic zombies +1 Attack and the Destroy ability
See - now we have a super motivated squad of Poizoms ready for the final blow!
Oh, by the way, did I mention that these rank buffs stack?
So you can get a crazy combo if you plan it right!
Well, what are YOU waiting for?
Put this poor excuse of an Overlord out of his misery!
AWESOME!! ...Now that’s what I call a proper comeback!
Well... That's it! The student has become the master!
Now go out there and make me proud - Zombie Slayer!!!
K..mmmbyeee
